items.title: Northwestern University Nears Deal to Resolve Its Conflict With the White House
items.summary: The school, one of several to face pressure campaigns from the Trump administration, would pay a $75 million fine and have its research funding restored under terms of the agreement being discussed.

items.title: For Spouses of U.S. Citizens, Green Card Interviews End in Handcuffs
items.summary: Agents are arresting foreign-born spouses when they report for the final step to obtain permanent residency, and charging them with visa violations that could result in deportation.

items.title: Supreme Court Defers Ruling on Trump’s Effort to Oust Copyright Official
items.summary: An appeals court panel had said that Shira Perlmutter, the head of the U.S. Copyright Office, could remain in her role as an adviser to Congress.

items.title: State Court Rules School Vaccine Law Can’t Bar Religious Exemptions
items.summary: The decision was handed down by a judge in West Virginia, which has one of the country’s strictest school vaccination laws and one of the highest vaccination rates.

items.title: Judge Dismisses Georgia Election Interference Case Against Trump
items.summary: The president has now seen three criminal cases against him dissolve since he was re-elected last year.

items.title: Trump Defends Witkoff’s Tactics in Ukraine Negotiations
items.summary: President Trump said the envoy, Steve Witkoff, was using standard negotiating methods, after he appeared to coach a Russian official in a leaked call.

items.title: Trump calls Times reporter ‘ugly’ days after branding another journalist ‘piggy’
items.summary: <p>In a Truth Social post, the president lashed out at journalist Katie Rogers after a Times article questioned whether he was slowing down</p><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/donaldtrump">Donald Trump</a> lashed out on Wednesday against a <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/media/new-york-times">New York Times</a> reporter, calling her “ugly inside and out” in his latest personal insult against female members of the media after last week calling another “piggy”.</p><p>In a <a href="https://truthsocial.com/@realDonaldTrump/posts/115616545250020843">Truth Social</a> post, Trump criticitized the newspaper for an article suggesting he was running low on energy in his 80th year, insisting he has “never worked so hard in my life”.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/26/trump-insults-new-york-times-reporter-katie-rogers">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: Democratic senator who Trump accused of sedition says he’s ‘not backing down’ amid Pentagon investigation – live
items.summary: <p>Senator Mark Kelly calls the investigation following a video of Democrats telling military members to disregard illegal orders ‘so ridiculous’</p><p><strong>Bloomberg’s <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2025-11-25/witkoff-advised-russia-on-how-to-pitch-ukraine-plan-to-trump">scoop</a> showing how Trump aide</strong><strong> Steve Witkoff</strong><strong> coached the Kremlin on the best way to get into Trump’s good graces is extraordinary for what it tells us about Witkoff’s dubious loyalties, and the Kremlin’s potential influence over US negotiation efforts. But equally interesting is the leaked material itself and where it may have come from.</strong></p><p>The <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/25/trump-envoy-on-russia-ukraine-peace-deal">story covers two intercepted phone calls</a>: one between Witkoff and top Kremlin aide Yuri Ushakov, and another between Ushakov and Kirill Dmitriev, <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2025/nov/21/who-is-kirill-dmitriev-draft-plan-ukraine-war-russia">who has been deeply involved in negotiations</a> with the Trump White House.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/nov/26/us-politics-latest-news-pete-hegseth-donald-trump-marjorie-taylor-greene-mark-kelly">Continue reading...</a>
